long: Meaning: the "front", of place (absolutely, the "fore part", relatively the "East") or time ("antiquity"); often used adverbially ("before", "anciently", "eastward").  Usage: aforetime, ancient (time), before, east (end, part, side, -ward), eternal, × ever(-lasting), forward, old, past. Compare "H6926".  Source: or "קֵדְמָה"; from "H6923";
